meanings.definition: To grind or strike the teeth together in anger or pain.
meanings.sent1: The angry dog gnashed its teeth at the intruder.
meanings.sent2: She gnashed her teeth in frustration when she couldn't open the jar.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character gnashed his teeth comically when he realized he forgot his lunch.
meanings.sent4: The old gears gnashed together like angry teeth in the rusty machine.
meanings.sent5: The storm gnashed its teeth, sending thunder echoing through the valley.

meanings.definition: To make a grinding or crunching sound.
meanings.sent1: The gravel gnashed under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent2: The branches gnashed against the window in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The old door gnashed loudly every time it was opened.
meanings.sent4: The gears gnashed together, creating a cacophony of metallic sounds.
meanings.sent5: The ice gnashed as the skater glided over it, creating a mesmerizing rhythm.
